Name: Ein Flug von München nach Venedig
Description:
The players draw lots to determine which vehicle they use for their journey. The starting point is Munich. The players take turns to spin and move. The spinner shows separate results for each vehicle. On some spins the slower vehicles may let themselfes be taken along by a faster vehicle.
If a slower vehicle meets a faster vehicle along the way, it may make an extra move using the actual speed of the faster vehicle. On some spaces events hinder the players.

The first player to reach Venice wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the book "Wie Hans von München nach Venedig flog" and "Der Blaue Kinderkalender 1923".

—user summary

Name: The Original Skaterhappy Card Game
Description: The Original Skateboarding Card Game was conceived in Afghanistan when a passionate Skater, on a mission and away from home, had the strong desire to feel the emotion of Skateboarding. Although riding his board was not an option, the tricks did not stop flowing in his mind, every time a bunker or T-Wall was spotted, a trick was inevitably created in his imagination. This game is the result of breaking down the creative process of skateboarding, allowing players to experience the excitement that skaters feel when formulating their tricks in the real life. It doesn't matter if you can jump or not. This is our language, our way of expressing the Art of Skateboarding action in our own words.

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Pledge of Honor
Description:
Pledge of Honor is an expansion for Heroes of the Nam bringing more tactical combat to Vietnam.  Lock 'n Load Tactical squad-level Series, with its fast-paced, intense impulse system, drops you right into the middle of furious jungle firefights and all-out, building-to-building assaults. Pledge of Honor depicts the US Army, US Marines, the Army of the Republic of Vietnam, and ANZAC combat operations against the People’s Army of Vietnam, the North Vietnamese Army, and the Viet Cong, as they fought across South Vietnam.

Pledge of Honor Battlepack brings the forces from the Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN), the United States Army and Marines, as well as their valiant Anzac allies from Australia and New Zealand, take on determined enemies from the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) and the unpredictable Viet Cong (VC).

Pledge of Honor Battlepack includes 8 scenarios and 1 new map, bringing to life powerfully armed Squads are at the vanguard of all actions, spurred on by daring Leaders and other unique individuals such as Snipers, Medics, Corpsmen, Chaplains, Advisors and, of course, Heroes, whose unique skills and sudden appearance can alter the tide of any battle. Helicopters, tanks, and armored personnel carriers (APCs) also join the fight.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Disney's 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea Electric Quiz Game
Description:
A typical 1950's electic matching quiz game.  Comes with 6 cards printed on both sides, each containing 12 illustrations and 12 descriptions. There are 5 additional Kiddie Quiz cards included in this set.

Players select a quiz board to use and answer trivia questions. Right answers are indicated by the quiz board lights.

To play, hold one selector tip in your left hand and place it on a contact station, or question. With the card above, we will select ‘Life Boat’ in the upper left corner. Then, holding the other selector tip in your right hand, place it on another contact station, or answer.

In this case, it would be the metal disk just below ‘Anchor’ on the upper side of the Nautilus, between the Vertical Fin and the Rudder & Propeller. When you have made this final contact, the circuit is completed and the red light will glow to indicate a correct answer. If you were to place the selector tip in your right hand on the wrong metal disc, say in the lower left corner by the Anchor, nothing would happen, and you would have given a wrong answer. Play would then pass to the next player.

Name: Here to Slay: The Unstable Unicorn Promo Card
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Party Leader card automatically added to pledges of anyone who backed a previous Unstable Games / Ramy Badie project and available as an add-on purchase.

Card text:
"The Unstable Unicorn has no class. At the beginning of your turn, you may choose another player's Party Leader card. The Unstable Unicorn's kill is that Party Leader card's skill until your next turn."

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rogue & Gambit
Description:
Two iconic characters join the ranks of the X-Men with this character pack for Marvel: Crisis Protocol! Born with a power that is both blessing and curse, the mutant Rogue can absorb the powers and memories of anyone she touches. This remarkable but devastating power allows her to wield the abilities of her foes but leaves them depleted— or worse. Prolonged contact with her skin drains the vital energy from those she touches. Afraid to harm those close to her, Rogue fled her past life. A runaway from the American South, she started her career as a member of the Brotherhood of Mutants under Mystique before joining the X-Men to fight on the side of good.

Remy LeBeau is Gambit, a dashing scoundrel with the mutant power to accelerate the molecular energy of an object, transforming mundane items into kinetically-charged explosives. Raised by a gang of New Orleans street thieves, Gambit is a master thief and former member of the Thieves’ Guild. Forced into the employ of the Marauders, Gambit had an unwitting hand in the destruction of the Morlocks. Wracked by guilt, his life of wandering ended when he met Storm and him finding a new family as one of the X-Men. Now fighting to protect others, he dishes out punishment with his bo staff and trademark playing cards. With a little kinetic enhancement, Gambit always has the winning hand.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Juggernaut
Description:
This character pack brings the Juggernaut to life on the tabletop with a beautifully- sculpted Juggernaut miniature, as well as a stat card outlining all of his abilities. If his brute strength isn’t enough, three Team Tactic cards unlock even more ways for him to be a disruptive force on the battlefield.

Cain Marko is the Juggernaut, a human wrecking ball of unstoppable force who lays waste to everything unlucky enough to be in his path. He was once an average human before discovering the Crimson Gem of Cyttorak, a conduit to the power of the deity of the Crimson Cosmos, that transformed Marko into the Juggernaut. Possessing unfathomable strength and durability, he is among the strongest physical beings alive. Juggernaut has endless strength and kinetic power, with the ability to shatter mountains, and a mystical force field makes him impervious to any harm. Once he gains momentum, nothing on Earth can stop his advance.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – X-23 & Honey Badger
Description:
Laura Kinney, or X-23, is the 23rd attempt by the Facility, an offshoot of the Weapons Plus Program, to create a genetic copy of the mutant Wolverine. She was born to be a living weapon and had minimal human contact to enhance her savage and killer instincts. X-23 is a peerless fighter and assassin with all the mutant abilities of Wolverine, including a superhuman ability to heal from any injury, lightning-fast reflexes, and retractable adamantium-coated claws in her hands and feet.

Alchemax Genetics created Gabrielle Kinney from the building blocks of X-23’s genetic makeup. She was trained by Alchemax to serve as a bodyguard and elite fighter who possessed the same regenerative ability as Laura Kinney and Wolverine, as well as retractable bone claws. Her creators further enhanced her to be impervious to pain through an Alchemax nanite therapy, a painful process that shortened the lifespan of its subjects. She ultimately broke free from her cruel makers in Alchemax with the aid of her rebellious sisters and assumed the identity of Honey Badger as a member of the X-Men.

Name: Das neue geographische Würfelspiel
Description:
The Players take turns rolling 3 letter-dice. Now the players have to find a city or river with one of the 3 letters shown. The first to do so with each letter get to stick one of his pins to the map.

The first player to get rid of all his pins (8 to 12) wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to "Meidingers Kinderkalender 1927".

—user summary

Name: Die Walfisch-Jagd
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 51 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players gain or lose game coins.

—user summary

Name: Tempo! Das neue Märchenspiel
Description:
The players take turns rolling and moving. They start at space 1 and have to get to space 100 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Soulgivers: The Soulcrusher
Description:
The Soulcrusher is the 11th hero to reach the battlefield.

Transform the Souls into a destructive weapon and hit your enemies from afar with the Soulcrusher.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Soulcrusher and a Specter Soulcrusher.

This expansion is a Kickstarter exclusive, and it is available only during Gravity Games Kickstarter campaigns and special events.

Name: Soulgivers: The Aeger
Description:
The Aeger is the 12th hero to reach the battlefield.

Control the Decay and consume your enemies with the Aeger’s dark knowledge.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Aeger and a Specter Aeger.

Name: Soulgivers: The Whisperer
Description:
The Whisperer is the 13th hero to reach the battlefield.

Encourage your hero and subdue your enemies whispering ancient litanies with the Whisperer.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Whisperer and a Specter Whisperer.

Name: Soulgivers: The Gatekeeper
Description:
The Gatekeeper is the 14th hero to reach the battlefield.

Surprise the enemy with new paths for your heroes thanks to the Gatekeeper’s Gates.

This hero is an expansion of the Soulgivers Core Set and includes a Shell Gatekeeper, a Specter Gatekeeper and four Gate Modifiers.

Name: Escape 2222
Description:
In a dehumanised future, where every trace of culture dies one at a time, a powerful corporation sends its time thieves to the past with the mission to reshape crucial historical events according to their own vision. Their goal being to erase the very idea of revolution.

Professor Constant and his team created their own time machine to stop that corporation. But no one heard from them since their last mission which took place during the French Revolution.

In 2222, you and your group find refuge in what happens to be the Professor's lab…

The game includes 2 chapters lasting about 120 minutes each.
It features 60+ minutes of original audio fiction, 30+ puzzles, 24 historical facts to uncover and listen to.
Play with your mobile device or with the online web interface. No rules to read, the game begins as soon as you open the box.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Conquest of Indarium
Description:
Teleported to a new world, the Players find mounts and gain the ability to ride them, causing them to become Riders. Riders move their Mount Pieces space to space on tiles based on the roll of a d4, discovering more of the world as they do by setting new tiles when they reach the end of a tile. Riders take different actions depending on the type of space that is landed on when they run out of movement. These actions cause you to gain items, equipment or spells, meet interesting characters, participate in wacky events, or fight Akuwu which are the monsters of the land in order to either Liberate towns or remove them from the road. When fighting Akuwu, Riders use their equipped equipment and miscellaneous items and spells to attempt to have more Kapow than the Akuwu they are fighting, rolling dice when necessary to raise Kapow by the roll, in order to defeat them and gain rewards that add to the Riders worth. Riders have 16 turns to gain the most worth before the final Boss appears, whether it be in the form of pure Gilver obtained throughout the game or assets such as items, equipment, spells and Liberated Towns that are automatically sold at the end of the game. The Riders must defeat the boss, either together or on their own to reap the rewards or else face the consequences of failure.

—description from the designer

Name: Im Kampf mit dem Auto
Description:
The players represent either an automobile (black track), a bicyclist (red track) or a pedestrian (blue track) ant take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Dan Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus
Description:
Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus is a target game based on the Science fiction Comic book hero Dan Dare.

The target board features a base that is standing on wooden stands. Weird and wonderful space creatures with prehistoric and reptilian features sit atop of the base.

Players win the game by knocking down the space creatures using a primitive spring loaded gun that fires a wooden bead.

Name: Orion's Gate
Description: Rules for giant space ship or naval battles with lots of customization. Each round the ships can move, cruise, ram and shoot depending on what type of ship it is. The different ship types is scouts, fighters, destroyers and battleships. The game ends after four rounds and the player that controls most objective markers wins.

Name: Katz und Maus
Description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and must reach space 60 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Tributo de Sangre: Annual, 1921
Description:
Tributo de Sangre (Tribute of Blood) is an operational game for two players, framed in the colonial conflict that confronted the Spanish Army with the hardened local tribes of the Rif (North of the Moroccan Sultanate) which was administered by Spain as a Protectorate. The game focuses on the peak phase of the conflict, led by the Campaign before and after the so-called "Annual Disaster" (1921), which caused the death in combat of thousands of Spanish soldiers. A tragic episode that would decisively mark the political and military future of Spain during the two incoming decades.

Tribute of Blood is a card driven game, with a map of areas that replicates the domains of the Riffian tribes, and a network of connected spaces that allow a “point to point” movement through a rugged territory, suitable for ambushes and surprise raids The basic mechanics consist of the use of action points to deploy movement, logistics, offensive and diplomatic operations. The events of the cards will serve as drivers of these actions, while providing the necessary "historical flavor". During each game turn, players will be able to launch raids, incursions, charges, sieges, assaults..., as well as pressure their opponent with various diplomatic actions.

In Tribute of Blood, one player represents the Spanish Army and another the Riffian rebels. The game can be summarized in a pendulum movement, with both sides adopting offensive and defensive postures during different phases of the Campaign: the Rif side enjoys the initiative during the first turns and has the chance to cause a disaster similar to the historical one in Spanish lines. Starting on turns 6 and 7, the Spanish reinforcements will even the scales and provide the opportunity to regain control of the territory and avenge their deaths. The game is asymmetrical in many of its mechanics, beginning with the different positional "habitat" of each of the contenders: the Spanish formations move from point to point, through connection lines, while the Riffian rebels (harcas) unfold and move inside and through the areas (Cabilas). This means that there is not a defined combat front, and the Spanish must launch constant incursions to confront Abd-el Krim's warriors. It is a simulation of an irregular and asymmetric warfare, with interesting innovations on mechanics and interactions.

Tribute of Blood consists of the following scenarios, each with an increasing level of depth and complexity:

- 1. Historical Scenario: "Annual's Disaster" (5 turns)
- 2. Alternative Scenario: "Avoiding Disaster" (5 turns)
- 3. Advanced Scenario: “Recapture of the Kert” (11 turns)
- 4. Annual Campaign; 1921: (16 turns)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Luft-Rennen
Description: Each player gets a special air vehicle on a separate track. The slower vehicles get a start bonus. The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to arrive on space 50 on his track wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Sector 18
Description:
Sector 18 is a 1-2 player, Sci-Fiction themed, tactical space warfare card-game.

Rival factions are fighting over the territory in this sector, which holds precious resources. You must conquer planets, build ships, upgrade your base and ships, defend against enemy advances and ultimately destroy the enemy’s base to claim this sector for their own!

Features multiple asymmetrical factions, each with varying abilities and tactical strengths. During gameplay, players will take turns performing an action from the list of available actions on their base and shield cards. New actions are unlocked as the player spends Resources to upgrade their base and shield cards.

You win by reducing your enemies base to 0 health.
You lose by letting your base fall to 0 health.

—description from the designer

Name: Borstel und die Kräuterkobolde
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 37 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published as a supplement in the book of the same name.

Name: Doubloon Lagoon
Description:
Ahoy privateer! A hurricane the likes of which ye’ve never seen is bearing down on Doubloon Lagoon, the site of the lost wreck of the treasure-teeming megaship, The Dorado. Rumors have it that the storm is shaking the booty free of the clutches of the reefs, and rife for the taking. However, ye not be the only pirates in these parts, and the hurricane winds are filling sails, me hearty. So get all hands on deck and beat those bilge rats to the treasure, or send them to the briney deep.

This is a grid-based, pirate-themed, battle royale sailing game that uses mechanics such as wind direction, dice battling, and movement economy to race and battle your friends to be the last ship afloat with the most treasure aboard when the storm hits. You command 3 ships; a slow and heavily armored/gunned Galleon, a balanced Brigantine, and a weak yet fast Sloop. Each of these ships have different attributes in regards to bonuses they receive in movement, cannon power, and defenses.

Rather than chess-style movement, each turn the wind will (or may not) change direction, effecting all of the ships ability to sail on certain headings. Learn the actual points of sail used by sailers to maximize your movement and chart the best course to play the wind and best your opponents.

Each turn, a randomly generated chest of treasure will surface somewhere in the play area, creating an ever shifting goal for you while you fend off other players and dodge cannon fire. Win the game by being the last one afloat with most treasure when the turn-based timer runs out and the hurricane hits. Randomly generated wind, treasure locations, unnavigable-island tiles, and up to 8 players make for different play styles and outcomes with every session.

Name: 人狼コロシアム (Jinro Colosseum)
Description:
äººç‹¼ã‚³ãƒ­ã‚·ã‚¢ãƒ  (Jinro Colosseum) is a werewolf style card game from Japan.

Players start with a hand of character cards, play one form their hand, and draw another from a circle of cards. Players have two lives, and try to attack each other. If a player loses both lives, they are out of the game. If they draw a werewolf from the circle, they are also eliminated.

The game is won if one player is left standing. Otherwise, the player with the highest ranking character in hand is the winner.

The game comes with a standard deck of 16 cards for a quick, game, another 32 cards to be added to make an advanced game for 20 minutes. Finally, a set 5 cards makes a delux set for a longer game.

The standard deck includes characters such as Citizens, Fortune Teller, Bodyguard x2, Hunter, Tough Guy, Jester, Monk, and Werewolf. The advanced deck has more like Doctor, Assassin, Magician, Hermit, Lover, Knight, Sniper, Revolutionary, Queen, Musician, Mad Wolf, White Wolf. The delux set is a Lone Wolf, Black Cat, Cow Man, Demon Fox, and a Demon.
user summary

Name: Magnum Opus (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
Description:
The Magnum Opus set was released near the end of 2018, featuring six cards designed by winners of some of the most prestigious tournaments. It was only available to people who were able to attend the Magnum Opus event. Since then, many players have found it hard to get hold of the set, so we have re-released it with brand new art, updated wording, and modernized templates and glyphs.

—description from the publisher

Name: One-Stop Grocery Shop
Description:
This polyomino tile-laying, push your luck game is a two dimensional retelling of the classic grocery store dilemma- "Should I carry more bags with fewer items inside, or can I just pile it all in one bag and carry it all at once?"

Each player will start with a gridded card of their standard grocery bag, with a communal field of polyomino foods between them, separated into departments by color. On their turn, they will roll a die dictating which department they must draw from and place within the confines of their bag. You may exceed out of the "top" of your bag, but when you do so you risk dropping items or worse, the dreaded "bag rip."

At their discretion, players may draw another bag card from a pile (aka bags just in your car) to create more space to carry more items into the house. These bags have different dimensions - such as a convenience store bag, wine shop bag, clothing store bags, recycled totes, and more.

Scoring is resolved at the end of the game by totaling the scores indicated on each of the food items that you successfully brought to the house, dividing by the number of bags you used, and subtracting the scores of any of the food items that were dropped or suffered a bag rip.

Name: Interplanetary: Space Race – Expansion 3
Description:
The third expansion for Interplanetary, titled Space Race, enables competitive gameplay, transforming the experience into a two-player euro-game.
For the solo player, a new free-form sandbox mode is included as well.

This is not a standalone expansion as both expansion 1 and 2 are required to play.

Name: Valls 1809: Batalla del Puente de Goi
Description:
Valls 1809 is a Napoleonic wargame from the Spanish War of Independence. A battle in which Saint Cyr, commanding the French army, wants to finish off the Spanish army under Reding before sunset. Time is key for the French side while the ally must defend itself until night falls.

A simple block wargame for two players with a solitaire option.

With 5 minutes of explanation, it allows a dynamic game with several decisions that can be key to victory in approximately 15 - 20 minutes. It can be played with the basic module, but by adding the tactical cards, they give greater historical flavor and variety in the decisions of the players. Playing with events (optional) allow replayability in different hypothetical scenarios.

Will the Spanish army hold out until nightfall or will the potential of the French army be unrivaled?

Name: Lasso
Description:
A deceptively simple tile placement and enclosure game, Lasso pits two players against each other to rotate, flip, and exchange hexagonal tiles to be the first player to create a full contiguous loop around the center cow tile.

There are at least one of the two patterned ropes on every tile in play, striped and solid. There are special tiles with two of one pattern, or a "wild" rope that can be used by either player. On your turn, you may do one of the following: A) rotate a tile in its current position B) exchange two tiles in the play area without changing their orientation or C) exchanging a tile in the play area with the single tile you have in your hand. You may not take an action to simply reverse the other player's previous turn.

Weigh the odds of every tile you place and keep track of all of your possible lassos while looking out for your opponent's lasso. Be the first to round up that cattle before the other wrangler! Giddy up!

Name: Ridley's Games Room: Pub Quiz
Description:
Points are scored by answering quiz questions correctly. To win the trophy you need to be in the team with more points at the end of the game.
Each team should take a pencil, a chance chip and a joker chip.
There are 200 Quiz question cards (1000 questions in total) divided in ten categories.
For a quick game select 10 question cards, one for category.
For a full-length fame select 20 question cards, two for category.
The Question Master reads questions and each team write their answers on their answer sheets.
Additionally once per game, per team a joker chip or a chance chip can be played (not in the same round).
With joker chip: each correct answer of that team in this round counts double, but each wrong answer counts a -1 point.
Chance chip: When a question is read, a team can pass for it and get one point without answering, by spending the chance chip instead.
The team with more points at the end wins.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Grand Master Yoda Commander Expansion
Description: Bring one of the most iconic Jedi to your Republic armies with the Grand Master Yoda Commander Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Yoda has trained generations of Jedi Knights and he brings his skills both as a mentor and with a lightsaber to your armies. Whether he is aiding friendly units or using his mastery of the Ataru form of lightsaber combat, Yoda adds a powerful new option to the Republic’s ranks. This expansion adds this legendary Jedi to your Star Wars: Legion collection, beginning with two beautifully detailed, unpainted Grand Master Yoda miniatures that can be assembled in a variety of poses, such as leaping into battle or concentrating while reaching out with the Force. All of Yoda’s skills, including his deep connection to the Force, are laid out on a unit card and his three signature command cards. These substantial powers can be further augmented by eight upgrade cards that grant him new Force powers and ways to command your armies. Finally, this expansion also includes a Republic unit card and an additional command card for the mighty Wookiee Chewbacca, allowing you to use your existing miniature in this faction.

Name: Toongeon Fights
Description: Toongeon Fights is a cooperative toongeon crawling deck-building game for 1 to 4 players, on which you will have to explore encounter cards in order to fight monsters, get around trap rooms, pick up treasures, solve event cards and finally defeat one of the six monster bosses to claim the great treasure of the Toongeon and win the game!

Name: Post Mortem LA: Lights... Camera... Murder!
Description:
Lights, Camera, Murder! is a Narrative mystery game inspired by Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective. The game exists in a boxed version and as a book.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

The case centers around the murder of movie-star Clara Rose and her estranged husband Joe Fletcher. They were found shot to death on the dusty backlot of Orpheum Pictures. Classic murder-suicide? Hollywood rivalries that became too real? Mob debts unpaid? Or perhaps something far more sinister... As the Global Detective Agency’s newest recruit, it is up to you to find the truth.

Name: Wer sagt zuerst "Hundert"?
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. For their next move the players perform the mathematical operation printed on the space they are standing on with the result of the die roll to determine to which space they have to move. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the children's book "Die Perle der grünen Nixe"

Name: Der sichere Weg
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On the roll of a 6 they start at the Kindergarten, School, Shopping Mall or House Nr. 12 and have to reach the location in the opposite corner of the game map, while minding the traffic rules.

The players have to stop on the red and yellow spaces. To move from a yellow space the player needs to roll an even number, to move from a red space a 6 is needed.

If the player wants to use the tram, he has to wait on the blue spaces till he rolls an odd number. Additionally he loses 3 turns while riding the tram. On the fourth turn he arrives at his destination stop and continues on foot.

The first player to reach his destination location wins the game.

The game was published as a cardboard assembly kit.

Name: Play the Ball Australian Football
Description:
Play the Ball is based on the popular sport of Australian Rules Football. The game has two opposing teams that move a disc (the ball) up and down a numbered path on a rectangular board using a teetotum.

A player may land on a favorable spot such as "Mark" or "Play On" and get another spin. The player may also land on a penalty spot and turn the ball over to the opposing team. The opposing team then moves the ball to the opposite position and has a spin.

Teams score points by advancing the ball along their side until they reach spot 17 or 21 and receive 6 points (a goal) or 16 or 20 for one point.

Play time is agreed by players at the beginning of the game and the team with the highest tallied score at the end of time is the winner

Name: Das Dan Cooper-Weltraumspiel
Description:
Each player chooses one of four planets for his base. They get a spaceship and 7 conquest marker. The players take turns spinning the spinner and moving the spaceships accordingly. On unoccupied planets conquest markers are placed.

On planets marked with a red number, the players have to draw an action card and follow the instructions printed thereon.

If the spinner shows a robot, the player may place a robot on an unconquered planet, which now is reserved for later conquest.

If the spinner shows a monster, the player may conquer an already conquered planet for himself.

The game ends when all planets are conquered or an agreed on time limit has passed. The players add the numbers on their conquered planets and the player with the highest result wins the game.

The game was published in the comic magazines "Zack" Nr. 21 and 22 (1980).

Name: トリック・オア・トリート (Trick or Treat)
Description:
ãƒˆãƒªãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ»ã‚ªã‚¢ãƒ»ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒˆ (Trick or Treat) is a card game from Japan. It uses a rock-paper-scissors mechanism to collect chocolate or sweets whilst going Trick Or Treat.

Players have three cards in hand, Trick, Candy, Chocolate, and choose one to place face-down. When all players have chosen, the cards are turned up and resolved.

If a majority have chosen candy or chocolate, then cards are collected from the sweets deck. But if a trick card is in play, that player can take cards from the others. The different majorities are resolved in different ways.

There is a deck of sweets shuffled and placed face-down. Depending on who won the round, cards are turned face-up and collected from the deck. these cards include candy, chocolate and ghosts. Players are trying to collect sets of candy or chocolate to win.

If a ghost turns up, it is set aside but the payer gets to steal cards from their neighbour.
user summary

Name: Blow it Up!
Description:
Greedy miner dwarves are in a diamond mine, each with a dynamite and some matchsticks. Any one of them tries to collect more gems and in this way, they do anything; even stealing gems from others. Time is passing and the fuses are getting shorter and shorter. Whose dynamite will explode? Whose gems will survive? Who is the winner of this greedy game?

The game is played over several turns. Each player in their turn, roll all 6 dice. Then must choose to keep or re-roll some or all of them up to two times. Then they must resolve the dice results. Depending on what are the results, the player may: turn on the fuse of other players’ dynamite; turn his/her dynamite off; pick some gem tokens from the bag; steal some gem tokens from other players; and save some of his/her gems.

Any "Sand glass" die rolled, cannot be re-rolled. For each sand glass die rolled, one “sand” marker is moved from the upper bulb to the lower one to resemble the passage of time. Whenever the upper bulb runs out of sand, one of the central pieces of each dynamite which has burning fuse is removed.

When only one player (or no player) has unexploded dynamite left, the game ends. Then all players flip over their gem tokens and the player with the most gems is the winner.

Name: Tribal
Description:
Tribal is inspired by Patience, but it's not a solo game! Observation and strategy are key elements.
Follow the wise African's advice: "Ask your ennemi for advice and do the opposite! "

Just like Patience, make cards piles by alternating colors to complete your sacred piles (from 1 to 9). You play with your cards as well as with your opponent's: steal theirs or give them some to take the advantage and slow them down.

The first one to complete their 4 sacred piles wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

This game is very similar to what is called "Zankpatiencen" (quarrel patiences) in German Patience rulebooks or to Russian Bank.

Name: Ka Pai: Roto Waho
Description: Variant of Ka Pai released during quarantine, where the result of both dice is used on separate sides of the field.

Name: The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero
Description:
ã‚¬ãƒ‹ãƒ¡ãƒ‡æˆ¦è¨˜Zero (The War Chronicles of Ganymede Zero) is a two player card game from Japan in which Mechs are enhanced with transparent cards.

The battle for new resources discovered on Jupiter's moon Ganymede was fierce: in 208X the battle using humanoid weapons called Mechs began in earnest, and Mechs with various equipment appeared on the scene.

The game is a card game in which players use transparent cards to equip three Mechs and fight battles with the equipped Mechs; each Mech can be equipped with three different types of equipment: right hand, left hand and back.

Who will be the first to defeat the opposing unit?
user summary

The publisher says:
In the year 208X, over the resources discovered on Jupiter, a war broke out between the Nyekundu force and the Vert force.
On the satellite Ganymede, the foothold for mining the resources on Jupiter, humanoid battle weapons called Mechs were engaged in battles.

In this game, players, each as the captain of a platoon, aim to destroy the enemy force.
The player who destroys all three Mechs of their opponent wins.

Name: Wie ben ik?: Het Spel
Description: A party game to guess who, what and where you are. A spinning wheel decides what type of question you can ask. Played with three different categories, who first has unraveled their card in each of the three categories wins the game.

Name: Marvel: Rock Paper Heroes – Enter the Danger Room
Description:
Rock Paper Heroes: Enter the Danger Room is a fast and frantic reimagining of the classic game of throwing hand gestures. Now, these gestures represent the powerful mutant abilities of eight iconic heroes who are training to become protectors of mutantkind!

Whether you want to use a mastery of the weather like Storm, cosmic-fire like Phoenix, or you're simply the best at what you do like Wolverine, get ready for some fun in the Danger Room that can't be missed! The hero that makes the best use of their powers and has uncanny reactions to the situation they're in will win.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: ツクローマ (Tsukuroma)
Description:
ãƒ„ã‚¯ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒž (Tsukuroma) is a card game from Japan. Players are trying to build the highest rank of three cards using only the Roman numerals I, V and X. But each card they discard has an effect which is applied at discard.

The game has only 16 cards; 8 I Cards, 5 V and 3 X cards. The deck is shuffled, payers are dealt three hand cards and the remainder go as a draw pile. On a player's turn, they draw one card and either place one card in front of themselves or discard one card. each card has a special effect, and the one they discard is applied immediately.

The game ends when the deck is exhausted. the player who built the highest combo, from III to XXX, is the winner. 
user summary

Name: BattleTech: Spotlight on Manyfold Paths
Description:
Few Com Guard commands claim a more storied history than the Manyfold Paths. History remembers them fighting the Jade Falcons to great effect on Tukayyid and elsewhere. They also took the fight to the Word of Blake in the Chaos March. Later, they fought in the Great Refusal before the formation met its final end on Terra during Case White. Today the Manyfold Paths legacy continues in both spirit and will in the White Lions mercenary company, commanded by Seth Nicholson, a direct descendant of one of Manyfold Paths’ commanders. The White Lions made a name for themselves fighting Malvina Hazen’s Jade Falcons.

Spotlight On: Manyfold Paths includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.

Name: たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。 ミニ拡張セット ─トニカクカワイイ─ (Instant Propose: Tonikaku Kawaii)
Nur der Tod träumt nicht
Description:
You and three friends slip into the roles of the four characters for one evening, solve the tricky puzzles together, find the culprit among yourselves, solve the murder and spend an exciting and fun evening with "Nur der Tod träumt nicht" ("Only Death Doesn't Dream").

Background
Drenched in sweat, you wake up, having been rudely awakened. You are a participant of an experiment about dreams with Prof. Dromen. Last night you went to bed under his care in the sleep laboratory together with other test persons. That same night, Prof. Dromen was murdered in the diagnostic room. Did someone have a score to settle with him? Does the murder have something to do with the experiment? Or is it all just a bad dream? Uncover the secrets of the other players and find the murderer.

—description from the publisher

Name: Satchel Quest
Description:
Satchel Quest is a rogue-like bag-building puzzle game where players take on the role of dungeon-crawling adventurers, trying to make it the furthest into the dungeon to claim the most valor! Players will build a satchel of weapons, spells, items, traps, monsters, and loot - creating synergistic combinations in order to be victorious! Players also gain power-ups that let them manipulate their bags and the dungeon, and mitigate the luck-of-the-draw!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dwellings of Eldervale: Shapeshifter
Description:
Eldervale is a land of opportunity and rumors abound with skillful Mercenaries willing to fight for any side willing to pay. Mercenaries are optional Units (not Monsters) that may each be included separately at the beginning of any game.

To include a Mercenary, simply place the miniature of standee and corresponding Mercenary card in a central area that all players can see and reach at the start of the game.

As a Free Action on your turn, using either Gold or an Orb, you may hire a Mercenary. The hired Mercenary is placed directly into your Ready Area and is available for use. If you paid Gold to hire the Mercenary, it will be yours until the end of your next Regroup action. If you hired the Mercenary using an Orb, it is yours for the rest of the game.

The Shapeshifter is an optional play expansion mercenary for Dwellings of Eldervale that now starting with the 2nd printing (initial Second Edition printing) comes in its own tuckbox. This expansion is now only available as a separate expansion pack. Included in the tuck box is the 50mm Shapeshifter miniature, standee, and corresponding game card. For the right price you can hire the Shapeshifter, a very versatile ally.  The Mimic ability allows you to use one of your other Unit's abilities, except Build.

ALL First/Kickstarter Edition copies of Dwellings of Eldervale came with a surprise/hidden Shapeshifter placed under the bottom tray of the game box. Because this was a closely held secret until the first of the campaign rewards were opened by Kickstarter campaign backers, the Shapeshifter is not pictured in the first printing of the rulebook, but the Shapeshifter card did come in the standard card pack shipped with all copies to "spark the hunt".

—description from publisher

Name: Clash of Decks: Champion – The Ukrainian
Description:
The Ukrainian is a promo champion that was created during the Russian/Ukrainian War.  It was offered in a "pay what you want"- model that provided anybody willing to donate a copy of the Starter Kit and the exclusive Champion Card.

The card needs a starter kit/ advanced deck to be playable.

The Ukrainian
Mana Cost: 3
Attack: 1, Defense: 4

The special abilities are:
Protection
Indestructible
Defender

Name: Dark Files: 01-KOMA
Description:
Dark Files: 01-KOMA is a multimedia detective game experience in a realistic criminal case.

Detectives work together to solve a case with the help of the information provided in different ways: Some information is provided by the printed media within the game (like newspapers, photos, business cards, letters etc.), another part of the information is provided digitally (on websites, by phone calls or SMS). Therefore the following tools are necessary to play the game: mobile phone and internet browser.

What happened to Ben? - You find your friend Ben (39) knocked out and unconscious in his kitchen. After taking the necessary steps to help him, you wonder what could have happened. As a friend and close confidant, you dive into Ben's life and try to find out with your mutual acquaintance Larissa why Ben fell victim to this crime. And what does his current case have to do with it?
A gripping and multidimensional TRUE CRIME detective game experience.

Koma is the 1st case of the dark files detective game series. Each case is self-contained. Dive into the exciting world of detective games. Solve puzzles, crack codes, examine documents, combine evidence and facts, draw conclusions and solve the case!

Name: Market Works
Description:
Market Works is an engaging card game that immerses players in the world of finance and investment through strategic gameplay. Designed for 2-4 players, this game combines the thrill of competition with the intricacies of managing finances, making it a captivating experience for both casual gamers and those with an interest in the financial markets.

In Market Works, players start with a set amount of money and a goal to be the first to accumulate $50,000 without incurring debt, or to be the last one standing after all other players have either gone bankrupt or been unable to manage their debts. The game is played with a deck of cards divided into three main types: Action, Market, and Expense cards, each playing a crucial role in the game's dynamics.

The gameplay revolves around investing money, handling unexpected expenses, and navigating the volatile market to maximize returns. Players can invest their money during their turn, locking it up until a Market card is played, which will determine the return on their investments based on market conditions represented by the Bull and Bear cards. Bull cards double the investments of all players, while Bear cards halve them, adding a layer of risk and strategy to the investment decisions.

Action cards offer players opportunities to directly influence their own financial standing or interfere with their opponents' strategies. These include the Spy card, allowing a player to view another's hand; the Rob card, which lets a player steal a card from an opponent; and the Loan card, providing a quick cash boost at the risk of incurring debt.

Expense cards introduce an element of unpredictability, simulating real-life financial challenges that require players to pay specified sums to the bank. These expenses must be paid with savings, adding a strategic layer to managing invested and uninvested funds.

Market Works is not just a game of chance; it requires strategic thinking, careful planning, and a bit of cunning to navigate the financial challenges and opportunities that arise. With its mix of competitive gameplay, financial strategy, and a dash of luck, Market Works offers high replay value, ensuring that no two games are ever the same. Players will need to adapt their strategies in response to the dynamic market conditions and the actions of their opponents to emerge victorious.

Whether you're looking for a fun way to spend an evening with friends or family or you're a budding financier eager to test your investment strategies in a risk-free environment, Market Works promises a compelling and enjoyable experience that will keep you coming back for more.

Name: ダイエットリテ (Dietrick-taking)
Description:
ãƒ€ã‚¤ã‚¨ãƒƒãƒˆãƒªãƒ† (Dietrick-taking) is a trick-taking game from Japan.

Your fat tummy, upper arms, and thighs have continued to advocate for a diet.
And finally, you decided to listen to their voice (that's so great).
The player who finds the balance between diet and exercise and has the most successful diet will be the winner.

Trick-taking with a card with numbers 1-9 and 4 suits, the winner of trick raises 2 types of the gauges. The lowest player gives each player a hand of cards and replenishes his or her hand from the deck.

The player with the smallest difference between the numbers on the two gauges wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cults & Covens: Cults
Description:
In this Cults & Covens game. Players take on the roles of Lovecraftian gods competing to grow the most influential cult. Villager cards from the play area can be taken as priests that can take actions and give their god influence over their families or cultists who can be drained for strength. Players must balance their need for initiative with their need for power and their need for influence over the 5 noble families.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Cults is one of three games included in Cults & Covens.

Name: Agents of Adventure
Description:
Agents of Adventure is a one-player adventure card game set in a fantastical version of 1920s and 1930s earth.

Players lead a team of three heroes on a thrilling mission, their every move hindered by an evil mastermind and their dastardly minions.

Every round, your heroes roll a number of dice equal to their dice stat. Each dice can be spent to perform an action like attacking, resting, furthering your objective or performing one of the special actions on a hero card. The value of the dice represents the speed and power of the action. Low rolls can be spent on fast, weak actions. Higher rolls can be spent on slower, more powerful actions.

The game is won when all the objectives on the mission card have been completed. The game is lost when all three heroes are incapacitated or you run out of time.

—description from the designer

Name: Auf Vorposten
Description:
Auf Vorposten ("On the Outpost") is typical roll and move game about WWI. The first player, who cross the route with 60 stops first - wins the game.
There are two separate routes (Germans vs. French) with equal stops but with different pictures and stories about actual war in different side.

—user summary

Name: Stressful Rally
Description:
Created with the spirit of arcade gaming : you put a coin inside the machine, push the start button, play 5 minutes, lose, put another coin, play 5 minutes, lose again, you don't have coins anymore, you leave, it's fun. Play a hand-drawn rally game from behind the wheel with a top notch view !

With a simple accelerate/decelerate mecanism thanks to 3 dices, an ABS system which gives you a dice bonus, a damage system and up to 3 unique vehicles and 6 stages to choose from, this game is a good filler which can take a short time to play thanks to multiple modes like "Quick race" or "Championship".

Participated in the 2021 7th Roll & Write Contest on BGG as the first board game of Kikwik.

Name: Borders: Europe
Description:
Grab your suitcase and lets explore Europe!

Borders: Europe is the game about discovering the countries of Europe and how they fit together.

As an owner of a set of Borders cards you and your family can play many different games. The main "Make the Map" game, players use the connections between countries to play out cards from their hand whilst building a map of Europe.

There are other games which kids can play solitaire or in groups, there are rules to balance games between different ages and skill levels, there are co-operative games and competitive games.

Through all the different game modes, players incidentally learn about the flags and countries of Europe, their connections, their capital cities and more.

Name: Cults & Covens
Description:
Cults & Covens includes 3 completely different games that are played with the same set of victim cards.

The victim deck contains 50 delicious victims from 5 powerful aristocratic families (10 each).

In each of these games, players play as monsters who are either eating these villagers or turning them into cultists, or vampire minions, or werecats, or drinking their blood. Players can play as vampires, werecats, or Lovecraftian gods and their associated cults. The 3 games play in the same environment and are fully compatible, allowing players to play vampires against gods, gods against cats, etc.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens is a boxed set, containing three games: Cults, Vampire, and Werecats.

Name: Gears of Industry
Description:
Gears of Industry is a Personalized Card Game (PCG) for 2-4 players. All players build their personalized decks from the same fixed card pool of two Tech Decks (52-cards). Each player customizes their own 26-card play deck to create a unique play experience to reflect their personality and play-style. Players also bring a customized 15-card Market deck contribution. Players combine their personalized Market deck contributions into a single communal Market deck. The theme of the game is an economic factory engine building game during the modern post-industrial era

Players play card(s) into markets. When the active player has three cards in a market that player can trigger a market clash (poker hand competition). They compete against other players by making poker hands to score points. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. The first to get to 7 victory points wins the game. Ties are broken with the value of a player’s factory and market cards.

GAME PLAY – Each player's personalized play deck will contain Technology cards (Gear cards) which represent factories. Factory cards allow other cards to be played into the two Markets. Horizontal (left or right-facing) Factory cards pay for playing Market cards. Upright and upside-down Factory cards can boost a market. Each market contains two neutral market cards. On their turn, the active player can use game effects on their Market cards or one of the neutral Market cards. The active player can trigger a Market Clash. During a Market Clash all the players compete in a Market by making the best poker hand they can using the player’s market cards, the two neutral market cards, and one factory card in the market boost orientation. The winners of the market clash scores victory points based on the rank of the poker hand they formed. Winning players score 1 victory point for a poker hand up to a three of a kind, or 2 points for higher ranked hands. Factory cards are rotated when Market cards are played and during the Market Clash step.

Name: On Base Baseball
Description:
On Base Baseball is a Sabermetric-driven tabletop baseball game using cards, charts, and dice. Using real MLB players gamers can recreate many modern and classic games and seasons. At its heart, On Base is a game engine that you can change and add to as you like. It is basic enough to be played quickly (similar to basic APBA or Strat-o-matic) but, through gamer mods, it can become more nuanced.

There are carded seasons for the game and there are whole decades of roster sheets available. The older cards have at bat outcomes right on the cards while newer card sets and roster sheets give you the values to use while playing the game but the outcomes are found on the game engine chart--the heart of the game.

Game play is based off of some of the original dice baseball games from the early 20th century--roll two d6 dice and a d9 (or d10). From that roll result the gamer cross references the player's game play values against the roll number to find the outcome of the at bat.

One of the unique features of the game is the pitcher/hitter interaction. Every at bat starts with the pitcher. If there is an outcome for the pitcher then the at bat is complete. If the outcome for the pitcher is blank then the outcome comes from the batter. The game is based on the DIPS Sabermetric theory so pitchers will affect strikeouts, walks, and home runs based on their ability to control those outcomes in real life.

Name: Dragonborne
Description:
Dragonborne is a solitaire fantasy wargame played with a narrative campaign. The player assumes the role of the titular Dragonborne: a person who is psychically bonded to an ancient biological war machine known as a Dragon. Together, the Dragon and rider confront a series of enemies human, mechanical and monstrous in tactical battles of resource and position management on their journey to fulfil their destiny.

This is a pure solitaire game. All enemy activity is regulated by an automata controlled by a single die roll per turn and answering a few questions. There are 29 different opponents included, each presenting their own strengths and weaknesses for the player to discover and overcome. Each battle is connected to the next by a story, and the player's resources are persistent from one fight to the next so thinking ahead is critical. Depending on the player's performance, they will end up playing one of three branching campaign paths, each with their own different opponents.

As the story progresses, the Dragon will evolve, gaining new powers and abilities randomly or as directed by the player along an evolutionary tree. There are 60 different evolutionary powers to choose from and combine, allowing for a huge range of strategies. You may end up with a massive, heavily-armoured Dragon able to absorb incoming attacks and retaliate using the attacker's own energy, a swift, nimble Dragon that outmaneuvers it's opponents before finishing them with precision attacks, an offensive powerhouse that rends it's enemies to pieces with jaw and tail, or a shamanistic monster that uses magic and the elements to overcome adversaries.

Name: Sa-Rê
Description:
Pharaoh is about to abdicate and give the reins of power to one of his children: the Sa-Re. To determine who will be the most able to rule Egypt among them, Pharaoh gives his children a mission: each of them should build a monumental city.

The most talented will receive the crown.

Each player has their own construction site, resources and workers, who need to be “incited” to work faster and better than the others. But beware of revolts that could paralyze your plans! Each turn, players can choose to push their workers beyond their limits to work more than necessary and accumulate resources to erect new buildings. These buildings will reward players with various advantages during the game.

Be the first one to erect a monumental city and rule over Egypt!

Name: Beast Clans
Description:
Beast Clans is a collectible trading card battle game, set in a post-apocalyptic world ruled by beasts.

Humans have vanished from Earth without a trace leaving only the animals to take their place. Over many years, they evolved becoming creatures able to fight. They created their own world of eight kingdoms: Ocean, Marsh, Jungle, Desert, Mountain, Savannah, Arctic, Outback and the Rebels.

Name: ロジカル真王 (Logical Thinking)
Description:
ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚«ãƒ«çœŸçŽ‹ (Logical Thinking) is a two player deduction game from Japan. Designed by a manga artist and published by a manga publisher, the game is sold in their stores and has a manga produced with it.

The deck has cards numbered from 0 to 9, and each card has a special action on it. Each player chooses two cards and hides them from the other player, standing them up in small standees. The players must deduce which cards are hidden.

The players start with two hit points. Each time a player makes a correct deduction, and accurately identifies a hidden card (an attack), the hiding player loses a hit point. When a player gets to zero, or starts their turn with no hand cards, they lose the game. But players can recover points when playing cards during the game.

Each player has a hand of the remaining cards, and take turns playing a hand card and then making a guess. The hand card played has a special demand, such as, 'is this card a 5 or higher?', or 'which card has the higher value?'. Other cards have actions such as, return a played card to your hand, and, your opponent may not attack this turn.  As cards are played out to the table, it becomes more obvious what cards are hidden.

However, when a hidden card is revealed, it goes back to the player's hand and they may place another card hidden.

By logical deduction, a player should be able to work out which cards are hidden and eliminate their opponent.
user summary

Name: Starlots
Description:
Starlots is four games in one played on a two-sided cloth board.  The various games encourage both competition and teamwork. The big adventure game on the map side of the board works like a miniature Lightraider mission with snippets of adventure on every card. You’ll face trolls, goblins, flowing lava, portals, and much more. The movement racing games on the flip side develop strategy and focus. The fast-moving letter game builds a quick mind.

Box includes flippable playing board that supports two games on each side. All games are played in turns, round-robin style.
 ZORPTFILTHUMPER is a letter jumble game with point values derived from which letters are used to make words.
ZigZag Dragon and Goblins at the Gate is a roll-and-move game where the board presents various obstacles.
 Lightraider Adventure (standard mode) is a collaborative game using card drafting and dice to complete movement-based, team objectives.
 Lightraider Adventure (enhanced mode) using an expansion First Watch card deck.

Name: First Watch
Description:
The shadows deepen around your campsite in the first watch of the night. An enemy appears. Rouse your companions!

In the First Watch box, you’ll find 85 verse cards suited by the Fruit of the Spirit. These are divided into a 50-card Lightraider deck and a 35-card Battle deck. You’ll also find rule cards plus a key card to help you use this deck with other Lightraiders games. The Battle deck includes the cards you need to score victories. These are verses used when battling allegorical enemies in the Lightraiders realm.

If you don’t remember the verse referenced on the battle card in play, use a lightraider card from your hand that matches its suit. Or recite a verse from a card in an opponent’s hand. Of course, you can only see the reference on the back of your opponent’s card, so you’ll have to rely on memory.

Lightraiders play this game on the road and at Lightraider Academy to practice sacred verses and prepare for battle. Now you can play First Watch at home. Even better, use your First Watch cards for organization and reference during other lightraider adventures. This set makes a great companion to the original DragonRaid Vintage Boxed Set or Starlots the Game. Game effects are listed on each card, and each card also incorporates a real-life Scripture application to expand your discipleship learning.

Intended as Bible memory verse tool that has been gamified to support an expanded/enhanced play method for DragonRaid and/or Starlots.

Name: Microbes
Description:
Microbes is a simple family game that entertains both the youngest and the parents. The goal: to stay sick by guarding against large microbes or by catching those of others.

Players receive a microbe card (value 1-10) and three more are placed in front of the card shuffler (brewer). Starting with the player to the left of the brewer, the latter will secretly look at his card and may be able to keep it, or exchange with the next player. The exchange is automatically accepted, unless the player under a Atchoum! of value 10, which means that the exchange is refused and that both players must keep their original card. When the turn of the brewer comes, he can keep his card, or else, having no one left with whom to trade, replace it with one of the three in front of him.

When the round ends, the player(s) with the lowest value card loses the round and a box of tissues.

Microbes est un jeu familial simple qui amuse tant les plus jeunes que les parents.
Le but : rester malade en garde pour soi les gros microbes ou en attrapant ceux des autres.
Deroulement: Après avoir pris leurs jetons boîtes de mouchoirs, chaque joueur reçoit une carte microbe (d'une valeur de 1 à 10) et trois autres sont placés devant le brasseur de cartes. En commançant par le joueur à gauche du brasseur, celui-ci regardera secrètement sa carte et pourra être la conserver, soit l'échange avec le joueur suivant. L'échange est automatiquement accepté, sauf si le joueur sous une carte microbe Atchoum ! de valeur 10, ce qui fait en sorte que l'échange est refusé et que les deux joueurs doivent conserver leur carte d'origine. Quand vient le tour du brasseur, il peut être conservé sa carte, ou bien, n'ayant plus personne avec qui fait d'échange, la remplacer par l'une des trois qui se trouvent devant lui. Lorsque le tour se termine, le ou les joueur(s) avec la carte de la plus faible valeur perd la manche et une boîte de mouchoirs.

Name: Reel 'Em In
Description:
In Reel 'Em In, one player takes on the role of a fisherman, and two or more players take on the role of fish. Fish players compete to get the most points, while the fisherman tries to catch one of the fish to steal their points.

While fish gain points by snatching up food cards, the fisherman steals points from the fish. Fish Players take turns selecting Fruit cards, which give them points!
 Hidden among the food cards is a hook placed by the Fisherman, and when a fish picks it up the Fish and Fisher compete! Each shouts their Powerphrase, and the first to finish their word wins.
 This results in either the Fisherman stealing all of the fish's points, or the fish swimming away. The fisherman benefits more when the fish has lots of points, so must place their hook down strategically.

The game ends when there are no more fruit cards left in the deck. The player with the most points wins!

Name: Burger Bear Bonanza
Description:
The Burger Bear Bonanza! Game from Mudpuppy is a fun new game to see who can really stack up!

Players can match, stack & steal toppings to build burger bears! Whoever completes 2 burger bears wins and is the bear to beat!

Name: Master of Wills: Waterborne Fringe War Neutral Pack
Description:
A group of nomadic sea travellers were forced to inhabit two islands in the cold and distant northern hemisphere centuries ago. These rugged people somehow survived the tidal apocalypse when a comet damaged the planet’s moon however, dust-like particles from the comet penetrated the atmosphere effecting only their small area of the world.

12 New Cards + 1 Holo Card

—description from the publisher

Name: Blockbuster Trilogy Box Set
Description:
Three great movie games in one big VHS. Each one is like a round of Movie Charades mixed with Family Fortunes.

Lord of the Rings. Back to the Future. The Godfather. There’s been some great trilogies over the years — but this one’s a real show-stopper.

Introducing the Blockbuster Box Set. Three dynamite party games about the movies you know and love, all wrapped up in one giant VHS bundle. Play them one at a time or combine all three games together for a big-budget, Blockbuster-style showdown. All you’ll need to bring are the players... and a decent amount of popcorn.

Name: Yea o Nay
Description:
Yea o Nay is a simple but very competitive game.

90 cards divided into 5 categories of math questions/ IQ statements/ patterns observations/ quantities and colours.  
Each card features a simple conundrum and each player have to be the first to guess/ estimate/ work out or remember if the card on the table is true or not ie yea o Nay. 
If the answer is yea – be the first to put down a green card and a red card if the answer is  Nay. 
Now with a new card on the table, the process repeats and so on.

Whoever is the first to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

Name: Chronopia (Third edition)
Description:
It is a dark time. The Old Gods have deserted the world. A new dark pantheon of Gods watches over the earth and feeds upon the spoils of war; a banquet of souls slain on the wretched battlefields of Chronopia.

Chronopia is a 32mm-Skirmish-Fantasy-System. In principle there are two kinds of strategy plays: Skirmish or Massive Battles. First turns around smaller engagements in loose formation, the other tells large mass battles.  Chronopia has alternating activation of the units, different actions, basing on d20´s and the general simplicity and an nice playing speed. All this was formed into an extremely flexible and innovative game.

Name: 妖精の施し (Fairy's Alms)
Description:
å¦–ç²¾ã®æ–½ã— (Fairy's Alms) (ãƒ•ã‚§ã‚¢ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚ºã‚¢ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚¹) is a co-operative game from Japan. Players are working together to get the two characters RÅ« (ãƒ«ãƒ¼) and KÅ« (ã‚¯ãƒ¼) (a cat-girl and a rabbit-girl). The two friends are 'dream world dwellers', and the aim is to make all their dreams come true together with them.

Each player gets a character to help the friends, and some numbered cards they keep secret. The player lays their cards face-down in front of them, from lowest to highest, with the negative numbers to the left, and the positive to the right of their character. In tis way, players give an idea to each other what cards they might hold.

The dream world is a set of Dream cards laid out face-down in the middle of the table. The cards are staggered from one to four and back to one. The players must guide the two friends RÅ« and KÅ« on a path through these dreams, but they only win if they can complete all seven steps.

Each time a Dream card is turned up, the players decide which number card they will contribute. They have to combine their cards to add exactly to the one of the numbers on the Dream card. So if the Dream card has a number 1, players can use a +5, -3, -4 and +3 to get a total of 1. Players can discuss what they might offer, but not the exact values of their cards.

If the players fail to satisfy one Dream card, the game is lost.
user summary

Name: Dinositters!
Description:
Dinositters! is an entry weight worker placement puzzle game in which players take on the role of two teenage dino-siblings competing against the other families to keep the newly hatched babies fed and entertained until your parents return.

Each turn, players will place or move one of their siblings to gather resources or add hatchlings from the nursery to their nest. Players earn happiness by feeding hatchlings their favorite foods, finding friends for them to play with, and completing lava goals. Whenever a player adds their ninth hatchling, a lava space is empty, or three nursery spaces are empty, every other player gets one last turn before adding up final scores. The family with the most happiness wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Heroes of Normandie: War Stories #00 – Hell's Fury
Description:
American troops are advancing into Germany. The beast is wounded but still dangerous. After many adventures, Wardaddy's Sherman runs over a mine and is immobilized at a crossroads. The radio broke down and has to be repaired as soon as possible. But young Norman, out on a reconnaissance mission, returns with grim news. An SS battalion is heading straight for their tank. Wardaddy convinces his men to stay and resist. They will hold to the last!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Dice Theme Park: Deluxe Add-ons
Description:
This deluxe add on box takes Dice Theme Park to new heights! Included in this box are 3D monorails miniatures and the inserts for each player count, the innovations mini-expansion which adds new customisation options to your park, and the surprises mini-expansion which adds exciting new attraction tiles and staff skills with new mechanics.

—description from the back of the box
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: The Pit
Description:
The Pit is a semi-cooperative dungeon/arena-crawler from 1 to 4 players with a duration of 8 rounds. In The Pit players act as legend who aims to obtain the absolute power contained in the depths of The Pit. In The Pit, you will not only have to fight for victory, but you will also have to work with your enemy to be able to destroy the seal of the Pit and defeat its guardian before the universe collapses and everything is swallowed in the nothingness. However, only ONE will be the winner... or NONE!

The game is divided into 2 phases:

     The 1st phase: Through 4 rounds characters explore The Pit, which is filled randomly with events. In this phase, the characters will have to accumulate as much power as possible to enhance their abilities. 
     The 2nd phase: During the next 4 rounds The Pit seal is activated by summoning an ancient Nemesis (Boss) into the battlefield. Characters must defeat it before the end of this phase, or the universe will collapse and the power of The Pit destroy everything.


To win, players must defeat the BOSS before the end of the 8th round,  then the victory points are counted. The player with the most  wins the game.

Otherwise, The game ends with the defeat of both players if the BOSS is  still alive at the end of the 8th round.

The Pit also offers a fully cooperative game mode, a solo mode, a boss rush mode and a sudden death mode more oriented towards PvP.

The Pit is calling!

—description from the designer

Name: Lord of the Bins
Description:
Can you find the treasure in trash?

Under the tyranny of the wealthy, JunkLand has become the world’s garbage dump. This once pristine land has been reduced to a stinky landfill. But for the Lords of JunkLand this place is a goldmine. There are treasures in the trash that help them earn a living and keep the world safe and clean. They are the unsung heroes of humanity!

Lord of the Bins is a strategy card game that tests players’ knowledge about segregating trash and your ability to outwit opponents. It involves elements of hand management, placement, trick taking and push-your-luck.

How to Play?

Segregate the waste in the Trash Cards and put them in the 4 bins - dry waste, wet waste, e-waste and hazardous & sanitary waste. Remember to put them in the correct bin and collect treasure to play special powers!


     Trash Marketplace - Players first collect Trash Cards from the marketplace. You can choose what to collect, but you place gems on what you skip! When you pick cards, collect gems too!
     Take Out The Trash! - Once you've picked cards from the marketplace, then you can drop them in the correct Trash Bin. Either play 1 Trash Card or play any number of gems for special actions!
     It's Garbage Day! - Here's the catch - Only 6 Trash Cards fit in a Bin then it's full! Also you must play the cards in a number sequence only! Gems, however, give you special powers to strategise and win!
     Let's Talk Trash! - If a player puts trash in the wrong bin, you can challenge them. The loser must wear the Raccoon Hat! Best to refer to the Trash Table Card to learn Trash Item goes in which Bin.
     Lowest Score, Wins! - Once all the bins are full and no players can play any gems, the game ends! Add all the Trash Cards left with you, this is your score. Player with the lowest score, wins!

Name: fairy light
Description:
fairy light (ãƒ•ã‚§ã‚¢ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆ) is a two player card game from Japan. Players build up a 5x5 grid of cards and try score the most hearts from the cat fairy ã‚³ãƒƒãƒˆãƒ³ (Cotton).

Each player is the Sun or the Moon, and they shine down on the forest where Cotton lives. The Sun brings warmth and growth to the forest. The Moon brings safety and guidance at night to the forest creatures. Which does Cotton love more?

The players have a small deck of cards with either Sun or Moons showing, including two double symbol cards. They also shuffle in 4 cards each, showing Cotton walking through the forest. The players draw three face-up cards from the deck, and a neutral Cotton card is placed to start the grid.

Players take turns adding a card to the grid and drawing a fresh card. The cards can only go adjacent to existing cards, not diagonal, and the grid cannot be larger than 5 cards in either direction.

The Cotton cards have arrows pointing in different directions (up/down, left/right, diagonally). The goal is to get the majority of Sun or Moon symbols along the lines that Cotton points to. Each player's Cotton cards also include their opponent's symbol too.

At the end of the game, Cotton awards hearts to the player with the most Sun or Moon symbols on the paths, and the player with the most hearts wins the game.
user summary

Name: Betopolis
Description:
Players move their pawn around the board. Most spaces allow to invest in a building project. First player may buy the material, next player (may be the same) landing on this space may buy the work needed for this specific project. If a player lands there again, the project will be realized on a vacant place in the center of the board but the player who paid for the material must buy an allowance. After that, the indicated revenue will be shared equally. From now on, the player who paid for the material may earn a rent if another player lands on that space. There are less places than projects. When all places are occupied, the richest player wins.

—user summary

Name: HEXXED
Description:
Hexxed is a shedding or discarding game for 2-6 players. Players can shed more cards -- and force other players to take cards, by making combinations of six using the colors and numbers on the cards. Hexxed is fast moving and easy to learn. The deck features six colors in nine suits of eight cards each, or 72 cards in a Standard Deck.

Each Hexxed card has two colors and two numbers from 1-6. To play, match either of the colors on one of your cards with a color on the discard. Zero cards let you change the color for the next play.

Special combos of six let you play again, or hex another player and make them take three cards. But, be careful. Your curse can come right back to you! The first player to empty their hand wins.

The Spectrum Back design adds color and variety to the deck without revealing your cards. Try a Hexxed deck for your original games, magic tricks, and cardistry.

Name: Marvel Battleworld Series 3: Ultimate Armory Battleball
Description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos!

Battleworld is a revolutionary cooperative, expandable, collectible adventure game featuring dozens of characters from all over the Marvel Universe! Players get to crack open the mysterious Thanostones during the course of play to reveal the mystery character inside for a constant sense of surprise and delight!

Series 3 introduces us to brand new locations, battles, and exciting new game mechanics that will continue to challenge players and test their strategies!

Name: Marvel Batleworld Series 3: Ultimate Armory Mega Pack
Description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos!

Battleworld is a revolutionary cooperative, expandable, collectible adventure game featuring dozens of characters from all over the Marvel Universe!  Players get to crack open the mysterious Thanostones during the course of play to reveal the mystery character inside for a constant sense of surprise and delight!

Series 3 introduces us to brand new locations, battles, and exciting new game mechanics that will continue to challenge players and test their strategies!

Name: ぼくちく!! (Stockbreeding)
Description:
You've started breeding stock!  To win, you will want a lot of animals!

Players flip over 1 card per round at the same time, and claim an animal from the center.  Players have to be quick because if someone else claims their animal first or else they lose their card for that round.

Each card counts for a point at the end of the game. The player with the most cards wins.

-- One of the Board Game 2 season releases

Name: Shadow Kingdoms of Valeria: Riftlands
Description:
A new shrine in the Monster-kin cavern has been discovered. Three magical rift gates in the shrine open onto Valeria castles rich in plunder and ripe for attack. You'll discover ancient relics to give your armies unique powers and as your collection of powerful talismans grows, so too does your desire to become the next General of the Shadow Kingdoms.

Riftlands introduces two powerful and thematic asymmetrical powers for each monster-kin race. One is active at the start of the game and the other can be unlocked when you complete a Battle Plan. A new set-collection mechanic is added to Shadow Kingdoms through the 30 Relic cards you can acquire in the Riftlands, and each relic also has a unique power to further the player asymmetries. An additional 15 new Champion cards are also added to leverage the new mechanics and ideas presented in the Riftlands expansion.

—description from the publisher

Name: Full Sun
Description:
The shape of the forest is determined by light. Trees are so tall because the highest tree gets all the sun! But not every tree needs to win that contest. For some species, too much light can be as bad as too little.

In Full Sun, tricks are sunlight. To win exactly the right number of tricks, you will have to play to the strengths of your own hand while also guessing how many tricks your fellow players are going for.
